solution_line_template: The cypress trees will earn Gloria {num_cypress} trees * ${price_per_cypress}/tree = $<<{num_cypress}*{price_per_cypress}={cypress_earnings}>>{cypress_earnings}
From the sale of the cypress trees, Gloria will also make {num_pine} trees * ${price_per_pine}/tree = $<<{num_pine}*{price_per_pine}={pine_earnings}>>{pine_earnings}
Finally, the maple trees will bring in {num_maple} trees * ${price_per_maple}/tree = $<<{num_maple}*{price_per_maple}={maple_earnings}>>{maple_earnings}

Combining all the amounts will give Gloria a total of ${cash_on_hand} + ${cypress_earnings} + ${pine_earnings} + ${maple_earnings} = $<<{cash_on_hand}+{cypress_earnings}+{pine_earnings}+{maple_earnings}={total_money}>>{total_money}
Subtracting the cost of the mountain cabin from the total will leave Gloria with a balance of ${total_money} - ${cabin_price} = $<<{total_money}-{cabin_price}={balance}>>{balance}
